article.headline: Liberty 95, Charleston Southern 80
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Seth Curry scored 28 points to lead Liberty to a 95-80 victory over Charleston Southern on Saturday night. Anthony Smith added 24 points for the Flames (19-8, 10-5 Big South Conference), and Kyle Ohman scored 23. Liberty led 46-38 at halftime, but Charleston Southern tied the score at 55-55 on a 3-pointer by Jamarco Warren with 14:59 remaining. Liberty then responded with a 12-2 run to take a 10-point lead on a 3-pointer by Curry with 13:04 left in the game. The Buccaneers would get no closer than six the rest of the way, and Liberty's 9-0 run in the final minutes gave them a 94-76 lead with 1:21 remaining. The Buccaneers (7-17, 2-11) were led by Warren and Omar Carter, who scored 21 points apiece. Carter also grabbed 10 rebounds. Charleston Southern has lost four straight games.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
